title: Multiply (1) by $$5$$ and (2) by $$4$$, then add to get $$38y+21z=12$$ (4).
Multiply (1) by $$7$$ and (3) by $$-4$$, then add to get $$58y+51z=12$$ (5).
Multiply (4) by $$58$$ and (5) by $$38$$, then substract and solve for $$z$$. Using $$z$$, plug back into (4) and solve for $$y$$. Using $$z$$ and $$y$$, plug back into (1) and solve for $$x$$.
